content.description: The bottom of the route is great, the rest is pretty dirty. I would give it at least another star if it was every cleaned. Great for a warm up.
content.location: 250+ feet to the left Stem Cell Research. Begins under a roof with huge jugs and moves past a side pull with a tree 30 feet up. There is a tree just left of the start at the base of the rock.

content.description: A a nice little sport climb that features a mini-roof mantel to a dirty ledge, crux. You may have to brush off the mantling holds before making the move. Bolted anchor with quick links for the rap.
content.location: Once you have descended the fixed line and the steep trail leading to Disarmament/Moby Dick area, continue on the steep trail leading to the falls. Head right downstream along a shaded face, it will be the first bolted line you see, right above a level belay pad.

content.description:
This is an interesting traversing line that is good for the area and actually requires some "trad" skill.

Start on small ledge below the left end of the wall with a bolt 15' up. Climb through a techy crux section to jugs. Continue up, passing gear and a pin to steeper terrain that leads to a chimney/dihedral. Get a subtle #1 camelot (shallow horizontal) up and right before stepping out to bolt. Move out and around the flakes, then up and through the last bulge with a bolt to an anchor. Lower off anchor.
content.protection: Full standard rack up to an optional #4 camelot
content.location: This is the gray buttress that is to climbers left of the descent, and to the right of the Stem Cell Research area.

content.description: Beginning in a gully. Climb the gully to a slight overhang them to a crack and a bolt. After the bolt move out right onto the Arata to a sloper finish. rap down useing trees
content.protection: One bolt Standard rack (TCUs, C4 An nuts)
content.location: Begins 150 feet left of stem cell and 50 feet right of we saluda you

content.description: A moderate clip up in a scenic area with a fun dihedral/ arete finish. See photo on the front of the Bradley Falls page
content.location: descend the fixed line, then walk 100 feet away from the waterfall, locating the obvious line of bolts. Note: it is the second buttress away from the fixed line.

content.description: Some hard moves to get started but fun climbing afterwards
content.location: from the base of the falls work climbers left along the obvious path, it will be about 60ft past Walrus

climbs.name: Sailing the Seas of Squeeze
climbs.fa: Mike Reardon, Adams Baker and co.

content.description: Fun! Start on the easy start of Hanging Root, then move right towards the detached block. An orange TCU can cut the run out. Follow four bolts past great jugs, once at the roof, plug a #5, sling it long, and make an exciting traverse right, pulling over the roof to anchors.
content.location: Climbs the left facing wall just right of Hanging Root. There is a bolt just above the block that is easy to see from the ground. Shares anchors with an unnamed 5.10 to the right.

climbs.name: Quality Control
climbs.fa: Jon Jones, Mike Flanagan, Nate Conklin

content.description:
FA: 2008

Start below a pseudo chimney and then work your way into a thin crack feature/ left-facing dihedral protected by small stoppers (brassies on FA) and TCU's (bomber small piece in the purple mastercam range after exiting the dihedral and before the bulge).

Finish on some powerful moves up and over a bulge, get to some good gear and ring anchors below the obvious ledge.
content.location: Route goes up the vertical face on the main wall across the river from the approach trail.

content.description: Left of quality control and bat Hook crazy, this route starts with some balancy moves with small nuts but great gear once at the first horizontal. Move up and right from here hugging just left of the arete then pull around the arete to then follow a ramp to the base of the mini roof. This ramp is very easy climbing (5.4 with solid rock) but does not have gear to protect it, thus the reason for the R rating. Once at the mini roof two fists size cams can be placed side-by-side. Pull the roof and stand up for two more pieces of gear. Slab directly up until the jug rail at the top out. Traverse left on the jug rail to a suitable stance to top out. As of 7/26/17 there is only a tree anchor so bring some cordelette to belay up your second or set up a  TR.
content.protection: Small stoppers, singles from .3 to a #3 Camelot. Extra #2 and #3 Camalot is optional.

content.description: A sharp arete ride leads to a 7 foot roof, then a dirty top to anchors. Would be much better if cleaned up
content.location: On a jutting buttress 100 feet climbers left of the falls. There are many lines on the buttress, this starts on the arete and heads to the left side of it.

content.description: Scramble up to the tree and start above the triangular chockstone. This chock stone is questionable so look out for the swimmers below and dont use it. Traverse left towards the arete and then up for some jugs. Traverse back right to the third bolt. Climb up and left from here and get good gear in a big horizontal. bust up and right with more gear before reaching the anchors.
content.protection: Three bolts, singles from 00 C3 to #3 C4, double bolted anchors
content.location: Across the river in the nook to the right of the falls. Start by crossing the river and take the fixed static line to the base of the cliff. Take a left at the cliff for Made of the Mist and a right for Quality Control, Bat Hook Crazy, and Otra Vez.

content.description: obvious corner climb. Great for beginners very easy maybe more of a 5.5 or 5.4 climb with one crux move towards the top
content.location: After descending the fixed rope turn toward the falls and walk ~10ft you'll see a set of rings here and one additional cold shut down and right a foot or so, rap down climb up or find your way down the hiking trail near by.

content.description: Climb starts off with some easier and dirty moves past the first two bolts and leads up to a big ledge to rest before the crux. I feel the crux is at the third bolt, but towards the top placing gear can be pretty tricky.
content.protection:
4 bolts, nuts, and cams to a #2

The guide book says nuts but we did not see any placements for them.
content.location: The right just left of Stem Cell Research.

content.description: 40 feet of easy but mossy climbing followed by 60 feet of technical and pumpy vertical movement. Start at a mossy wall 10 right of Stem Cell on gargoyle holds, run it out on easy terrain until you are parallel with a detached pillar. Plug a cam, then a nut in a small crack, then the climbing follows bolts at great and sustained 5.10.
content.protection: 5 bolts, Mid TCU's, stoppers, slings on overhanging tree with a hanging root
content.location: Start at a mossy wall 10 right of Stem Cell on gargoyle holds.

content.description: Great steep arete with the falls pounding behind. Tough finish.  Fun stuff if it were cleaned up a bit.
content.location: On the buttress climbers left of the falls, just right of Moby Dick

climbs.name: Brownian Motion
climbs.fa: Nick Colquitt, Mike Reardon, Nathan Brown

content.description: A dirty start leads to 5.9 jugs to a stopper roof. At the roof, plug tcu's under the roof crack and pull around left to a tough clip at the final bolt(crux). There were two oddly placed, close together bolts just right of this line. We guessed they were from an unfinished project or remnants of someone's bolting practice.
content.protection: 4 bolts, small TCU's, .75 and a #2 cam, two bolt anchor
content.location: Located just right of the obvious bolt line on Stem Cell, following a dirty easy ramp to a bolt 35 feet up. Anchor is located just left of the overhanging tree with a root sticking out.

content.description: Reach Boaz by walking to the furthest edge of the top cliff life. You can set up a top rope from here. Fun simple climb to the top. Crux is half way up.
content.location: Left of the Waterfall, just to the right of the lightning bolt crack.

climbs.name: Bat Hook Crazy
climbs.fa: Robert Powell, Andrew Hancox, Ground Up using cam hooks and bat hooks to obtain a suitable spot for a bolt

content.location: Thin arete left of quality control. Approach trail starts right next to the swimming hole on opposite side of the river. There is a fixed static line on this approach trail as it mainly loose soil as of 7/26/17. The line helps you reach the base of the cliff. When you reach the rock walk right.
